answerBox.snippet: Artistic value is just a term we use to talk about something's goodness or badness as art, and it is something comprised of (a number of) different determinant kinds of value, such as aesthetic, moral, cognitive, and political value. In this way, artistic value is attributive goodness.
snippetHighlighted: aesthetic, moral, cognitive, and political value

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the value of art in our life?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Art gives us meaning and helps us understand our world. Scientific studies have proven that art appreciation improves our quality of life and makes us feel good. When we create art, we elevate our mood, we improve our ability to problem solve, and open our minds to new ideas. According to Dr.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I find out what my art is worth?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Consider finding an appraiser to determine the value of your artwork. Appraisers are trained specialists who work for a fee. They evaluate your piece and give you a written statement of its value.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How Much Is Your Object Worth? | Smithsonian American Art Museum

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the value of art today?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Art serves as a tool for personal expression, emotional healing, and social progress, while also contributing to economic and intellectual innovation. Above all, the value of art lies in its ability to transcend boundaries, whether they are cultural, emotional, or temporal.
